title: Broccoli, Parma Style
introduction: Broccoli alla Parmigiana, or Broccoli, Parma Style, is a delightful dish that brings out the best in this nutritious vegetable. By combining the earthy flavors of broccoli with the rich saltiness of Parmigiano-Reggiano, this recipe transforms a simple vegetable into a gourmet side dish. Consider making it with a mix of cauliflower and broccoli for added variety.

instructions.description: Cut the broccoli into large florets. Trim off the ends of the stems. Peel off the tough skin with a swivel-blade vegetable peeler. Cut thick stems crosswise into 1⁄4-inch slices.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the broccoli and salt to taste. Cook until the broccoli is partially done, about 5 minutes. Drain and cool under cold water.
Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Butter a baking dish large enough to hold the broccoli.
Arrange the spears in the prepared dish, overlapping them slightly. Dot with the butter and sprinkle with pepper. Sprinkle the cheese on top.
Bake 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and slightly browned. Serve hot.

variations: For variety, make this dish with a combination of cauliflower and broccoli.
